info.name: Jobberman Recruitment Platform
info.description:
# Introduction

This collection will allow you to connect to [Jobberman Recruitment Platform](https://github.com/janto-pee/jobberman), which enables Employers, Company and Businesses - to post job vacancies and recieve applications from job seekers. This guide will help you to **generate access tokens**, **publish jobs**, **schedule interviews** and **manage an receive job ratings.**

This token will allow you to manage permissions and objects you manage, you can generate it by creating a session. Afterwards, make sure to select the environment in Postman and paste the resulting token under the `access_token` variable.

# To Get Started

To test out the Next Generation Recruitment API collection, we recommend giving this guide a look before getting started. After completing the guide, try our sample requests in the Delegated and Application folders.

item.description: Job portals allow job seekers to apply for jobs and employers to find candidates. The Users tool allows you create, view, apply and review jobs with employers, and companies and build relationships.

item.name: Session
item.description:
## Authentication

API request requires authentication to set permissions and privileges to enable access to authorized users. Authentication helps to identify the user license that is responsible for making the request. Authentication is provided by access tokens and refresh tokens

#### Role based access tokens?

Each license has two tokens:

- `Employer access token` - allows you to manage your job postings, scheduled interviews, salary expectations, set probation periods and more. The access token should never be shared as it gives full access to your account.
    
- `TB Salary access token` - allows applicant to apply to posted jobs, query endpoint requests to jobs
    

## Authentication example

Include this HTTP header for each API request:

`Authorization: Bearer ${ACCESS_TOKEN}`[.](http://app.chatbot.com/settings/developers)

## Error handling

In general, we use a consistent standard for error messages, that is, errors are returned using standard HTTP error code syntax. For example, most REST APIs include fields like `error`, `message`, `code` (an internal error code specific to your application), and sometimes `details` for additional information

### HTTP status codes summary

- 2xx – **The request indicate success. T**_he status response code from the server for successful HTTP requests_
    
- `4xx` – **Client Error**. The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error e.g deceptive request routing
    
- `5xx` – **Server Error**. The request method is not supported by the server and cannot be handled

item.name: Address
item.description: Each user (employer and applicant) can add an adddress. Make sure the user has a valid `access_token.`

item.description: A job application is a formal request for employment created by an applicant that typically includes a resume and a cover letter. This section will cover the basics of creating, getting and editting applications

item.name: Job
item.description:
A job post is created by an employer of a company. Job postings are public announcement of an open position in a company

This section will cover the basics of creating, getting a rating

item.name: FGS

response.name: Create FG Salary

item.description: Each user address (employer and applicant) can add a location. Make sure the user has an address and a valid `access_token.`

item.name: Metadata
item.description:
A job post can have additional informational. This additional information are referred to s metadata

This section will cover the basics of creating, getting a metadata

item.name: Probation Period

response.name: Create Probation Period Response

item.description:
Some jobs have probation periods. Probation period a trial period at the beginning of an employment contract that allows employers to assess an employee's performance and suitability for the role

This section will cover the basics of creating, getting a probation

item.name: Salary
item.description: Each job must have a salary. A job salary is the amount of money paid to an employee for their work
